pages.description: Beleagured, exhausted, and near death you crest the hill. Its chain link exterior signs of humanity.
Worn to the bone, you thumb the salvaged walkie-talkie.

"Papa, Indiana, November, Echo."

You rasp out the code, radioing the current watcher.

Moments drag on as your heart pounds.

"Papa, Indiana, November, Echo."

You repeat the passphrase. Seconds pass as an eternity...

Static crackles-

"Oscar, Alpha, Kilo.", comes the reply.

"Mayday, mayday. I need evacuation immediately. Supplies are running low. My heli crashed. I have been out in the wilderness for days. Over."

You let your rucksack fall to the ground with a weighty thump.

It's over. Finally, safe at last.
